api.controllers

Class AccountController

  • java.lang.Object
    • api.controllers.AccountController

  • @RestController
public class AccountController
extends java.lang.Object
    A REST Controller for endpoints relating to Accounts.
    Author:
    mattgogerly

    • Constructor Detail

      • AccountController

        public AccountController(@Autowired
                         AccountService accountService,
                         @Autowired
                         AccountAuthService accountAuthService,
                         @Autowired
                         MailService mailService)
        Create a new AccountController. This is handled automatically by SpringBoot.
        Parameters:
        accountService - Automatically provided service for accounts
        accountAuthService - Automatically provided service for account auth details (passwords, tokens)
        mailService - Automatically provided service for emails

    • Method Detail

      • getAllAccounts

        @GetMapping(value="/accounts")
public java.lang.Iterable<Account> getAllAccounts()
        Returns:
        Return a list of all accounts

      • testAccount

        @PostMapping(value="/accounts/test/{password}")
public boolean testAccount(@RequestBody
                                                                           Account account,
                                                                           @PathVariable(name="password")
                                                                           java.lang.String password)
        Test that we can connect to an Account using the provided details.
        Parameters:
        account - Account object to test
        password - Password to test
        Returns:
        Result of test

      • addAccount

        @PostMapping(value="/accounts")
 @ResponseStatus(value=CREATED)
public Account addAccount(@RequestBody
                                                                                          Account newAccount)
        Add a new Account and store it in the database.
        Parameters:
        newAccount - The new Account to be added
        Returns:
        The newly created Account

      • getAccount

        @GetMapping(value="/accounts/{id}")
public Account getAccount(@PathVariable(name="id")
                                                              java.lang.String id)
        Get an Account from an id.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the Account (hexadecimal hash generated on creation)
        Returns:
        The Account
        Throws:
        ResourceNotFoundException - if no Account by id exists

      • useAccount

        @PostMapping(value="/accounts/{id}")
public boolean useAccount(@PathVariable(name="id")
                                                               java.lang.String id,
                                                               @RequestBody
                                                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> payload)
        Stores the password/token for the Account in memory so we can use it in this session.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the Account we want to use in this session
        payload - A key value pair of password = (token or password)
        Returns:
        True if auth details were set successfully
        Throws:
        BadRequestException - if the password is not provided in the payload
        ResourceNotFoundException - if the Account is not found

      • deleteAccount

        @DeleteMapping(value="/accounts/{id}")
 @ResponseStatus(value=NO_CONTENT)
public void deleteAccount(@PathVariable(name="id")
                                                                                                    java.lang.String id)
        Deletes an Account from all services.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the Account to delete
